item.title: Im almost done... whoever helps will get admin!
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

Put this in there but make the _09’s fit your java… (the java that you have)

@echo off title YOURSERVERNAME Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_09\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java "C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.5.0_09\bin/java.exe" server pause

Change the YOURSERVERNAME to what you want your server to be called and make the _09’s fit your java so probably _06 or _07

Read full topic

item.title: Im almost done... whoever helps will get admin!
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

[quote=“Patchumz, post:6, topic:22872”]Put this into your file

instead of this @echo off COLOR 08 title YOURSERVERNAME Client "C:Program FilesJavajdk1.5.0_06injavac.exe" -cp . *.java "C:Program FilesJavajdk1.5.0_06injava.exe" server pause

put this @echo off COLOR 08 title PutWhateverServerNameYouWant javac *.java pause [/quote]
Don’t put that , you will get javac is not reconised stay with what you had. But change YOURSERERNAME too what evey ou want. Like BcScape or DragonScape or SunScape … just some examples (BUT MAKE YOUR OWN NAME DON’T LEECH ONE)[br][size=1]Posted at: November 07, 2006, 11:47:44 AM[/size][hr]Acually use this in your compiler:

@echo off title YOURSERVERNAME Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_09\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java "C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.5.0_09\bin/java.exe" server pause

Change the YOURSERVERNAME to what you want your server to be called and make the _09’s fit your java so probably _06 or _07

Read full topic

item.title: Im almost done... whoever helps will get admin!
item.dc:creator: @dr_jekyll dr jekyll
item.description:
@dr_jekyll wrote:

You dont necessarily have to change it to 8s you have to find which version it is that you own and change it to that. My compile looks like this:

@echo off
COLOR 08
title Tzscape Client
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_09\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
“C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.5.0_09\bin\java.exe” server
pause

Because i have jdk and jre version 1.5.0_09 , just find which version it is that you have and use that number

Read full topic

item.title: Im almost done... whoever helps will get admin!
item.dc:creator: @dr_jekyll dr jekyll
item.description:
@dr_jekyll wrote:

YOURSERVERNAME can be anything , its just there so it looks like your ownserver. e.g. if you server was called Bobscape you would put bobscape there. its not exactly hard… Your compile might be not workin cos u’ve got the wrong path set for the JRE /JDK files

“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_06\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_06\bin\java.exe” server

These are the parts that are proboaly wrong cos u shouldnt really be using 1.5.0_06 now , it should be 1.5.0_8 or whatever update u have downloaded

Read full topic
item.source: Im almost done... whoever helps will get admin!

item.title: Im almost done... whoever helps will get admin!
item.dc:creator: @Revolution1 Revolution1
item.description:
@Revolution1 wrote:

Yes i have almost everything! Now all i need to know is what do i put as YOURSERVERNAME? take a look at the code…

@echo off
COLOR 08
title YOURSERVERNAME Client
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_06\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_06\bin\java.exe” server
pause

i think thats why my compile wont work cause i need something special on there… Can you explain?
And if you tell me then i will have a mod admin ready for you :]

Read full topic
